title: A Godzilla vs King Kong movie is happening: The King of the Monsters will be crowned
text:
Wednesday, Oct 14 2015, 22:32 BST Share on Facebook Share on Twitter Share on Google+ A battle for the title of King of the Monsters will finally happen on the big screen in Godzilla vs King Kong .Legendary Pictures and Warner Bros are teaming up to bridge their monster movies with a 2020 film that will pit the creatures against one another.Legendary confirmed today (October 14) that Godzilla 's Project Monarch science organisation will connect both franchises.Those who saw 2014's Godzilla reboot will remember that Project Monarch was responsible for awakening the giant beast in the Pacific Ocean.Project Monarch's next mission will take place in 2017's Kong: Skull Island , when its expedition leads a small crew to discover the giant gorilla.Legendary's Thomas Tull announced: "Audiences really responded to Godzilla. Today, I'm excited to reveal that film was only the beginning of an epic new entertainment universe. "As a lifelong fan of these characters, I've always wanted to see the ultimate showdown, and today we're pleased to be announcing that and more." 
© Getty Images Warner Bros' Kevin Tsujihara added: "Working with our partners at Legendary, we enjoyed tremendous creative and commercial success with Godzilla ."It's great to be able to revisit these characters and help create a franchise with so many creative possibilities for filmmakers. Fans love these big, globally iconic films and it doesn't get any bigger than this."The current plan calls for Kong: Skull Island - starring Tom Hiddleston , Brie Larson and Samuel L Jackson - to open on March 10, 2017, followed by Godzilla 2 on June 8, 2018.These movies come together for Godzilla vs King Kong in 2020 – although an exact date hasn't yet been set.Fans of Godzilla may remember that Legendary previously licenced the rights to use classic movie monsters Rodan, King Ghidorah and Mothra in future spinoffs as well.A Japanese version of King Kong vs Godzilla was released in 1962 – at the height of the '60s monster movie craze.
